h2_title: Commander Beetle Boss Fight and Guide
img_above_text:
# Commander Beetle
The Commander Beetle is an optional Yaoguai Chief boss fight that you can find during Chapter 4 of Black Myth Wukong. Located between the Forest of Ferocity and the Temple Entrance itself, this boss trains a group of Daoists who will all try to stop you.
* Rewards: Commander Beetle Spirit, Knot of Voidness, Refined Iron Sand, 1562 Experience, 1434 Will
## Commander Beetle Boss Fight and Guide
The Commander Beetle would be a fairly straightforward miniboss fight, if not for the six Sword Daoists he's currently training in the large courtyard where you'll find him just past the Forest of Ferocity. Unfortunately, these enemies will respawn until you defeat the Commander, so you won't be able to get him alone so easily.

He can also adopt a ready stance and expel projectiles all around him. They'll fly about like angry gnats and threaten to deal several hits, but these are the kind of projectiles you can easily deflect with your staff spin.
img_below_text: Aside from this, he doesn't have too much else to worry about. As long as you can get rid of his students quickly, and react quickly whenever he swings the bigger sword, you can anticipate and retaliate against most of his moves. When he falls, he'll drop a Knot of Voidness, and you can claim his Commander Beetle Spirit.

img_summary: The image depicts a scene from the game "Black Myth Wukong," specifically during the Commander Beetle boss fight. The player character is engaged in combat with Commander Beetle, who is seen wielding a large weapon and surrounded by a glowing aura. The health bar at the bottom of the screen indicates the boss's name and remaining health. The context suggests that this fight occurs in a large courtyard and involves dealing with respawning enemies. The metadata and surrounding text provide a guide on how to tackle this boss, emphasizing the importance of quickly eliminating the accompanying enemies and reacting to the boss's attacks.
